data.message: My question is why FB doesn't institute more of the changes requested by users and stop making changes they really dislike. If FB is intended to be a leader in "social" media, shouldn't it be more "social" and user-friendly?

replies.message: maybe this is what this  Q&A with Mark is all about, being even more social, & Mark Zuckerberg getting more involved in hearing what we have to say. It is free you know. We shouldn't complain. FB has been great for lots of people connecting to family, friends, & more than we ever imagined.
ED White:you are so right ! i;ve been noticing some things about FB ......
You do realise that every change to the site whether it's publicly visible or not has to go through Mark first right? If he says no then it doesn't go live.
